posts.name: Ambrish
posts.cooked:
Hello,

We have outtake which puts out coral in vertical position. When we are scoring on L1 it is bouncing and falling off. Any thoughts/ideas on what possible tweaks we can do without redesigning it.

Thanks -Ambrish

posts.name: John Bottenberg
posts.cooked: What happens when you try to score in a corner of the hexagon - the green circled area - while having your bumpers pushed up against (and parallel to) one of the sides?

posts.name: Drew Sedam
posts.cooked: Do you have a video or picture of what your scoring mechanism looks like?

posts.name: John Hascall (he)
posts.cooked:
Without seeing your mechanism in action I can only ask:

How high are you attempting to score from and with how much downward force (if any) are you applying to the coral?  Is it possible to reduce either/both of these?
If you are launching in to L1 try making it slower.

posts.name: Ambrish
posts.cooked: We can slowdown outtake motor speed as it is manually controlled. Angle of outtake is about 45/135 degrees.

posts.name: Drew Sedam
posts.cooked:
L1 Coral Method

We have had success with this kind of method. We fully automated this so the driver can just pull up to the reef and it raises the elevator while slowly outtaking and it flips the coral into L1 reasonably consistently.

link_counts.title: FRC Team 1710 | 2025 Build Thread | Open Alliance

posts.name: James O’Leary
posts.cooked: Idk how high your funnel is, but we do something called “trickshot” where we have our funnel face the reef and we run the rollers in reverse and it lands in l1.

posts.name: Ambrish
posts.cooked: We haven’t tried this. But will give it a try and see how it goes. Thank you for the suggestion!

posts.name: M
posts.cooked: Tip punch it into the reef and launch at the same time it works.

posts.name: David Berry
posts.cooked: “Let the kit bots do it” has been my teams solution to this issue We get more consistent L1’s by going for an L4 and missing instead of doing our original L1 plan

posts.name: Alice Kuznetsov
posts.cooked: We’ve begun doing the same thing! It’s not perfect on ours but im sure it would work better with more tuning

posts.name: M
posts.cooked: I’ve seen only 1 kit bot at out regional.

posts.name: Kirby Caldwell
posts.cooked: Try slow outtaking into L1 and when it is hanging out, lower your arm to secure the coral into the trough.
